Screen.title: TopScreen
Screen.Label: ---------- Mouse Button 1 click on field to change ----------

Help.Tip: Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
Help.Text:
comp - PROCESSDEFAULTS
Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
 
 Default = SYSTEM
 Allowed = SYSTEM
 Allowed = PROJECT
 Allowed = USER
 SYSTEM defaults are the defaults listed in the CPS documentation.
 
 PROJECT defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as Project
 Default button.
 
 USER defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as User Default
 button.

Help.Tip: Method to use for identifying traces to be composited.
Help.Text:
comp - MODE
Method to use for identifying traces to be composited.
 
 Default = HDR
 Allowed = COUNT (Composite traces by sequential trace count.)
 Allowed = HDR   (Composite traces that fall into the same lowest level bin.)

Help.Tip: Number of traces to skip initially in the COUNT method.
Help.Text:
comp - SKIP_INIT
Number of traces to skip initially in the COUNT method.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = int>=0
 
 Skipped traces are passed through unchanged.
 
 Used only if MODE = COUNT.

Help.Tip: Number of traces to composite together at a time.
Help.Text:
comp - NUM_COMP
Number of traces to composite together at a time.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = int>0
 
 Used only if MODE = COUNT.

Help.Tip: Number of traces to skip at a time.
Help.Text:
comp - NUM_SKIP
Number of traces to skip at a time.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = int>=0
 
 Skipped traces are passed through unchanged.
 
 Used only if MODE = COUNT.

Help.Tip: Total number of traces to composite.
Help.Text:
comp - TOT_COMP
Total number of traces to composite.
 
 Default = 999999999
 Allowed = int>0
 
 TOT_COMP is the total number of traces actually composited together.
 
 After TOT_COMP traces are composited, all additional traces are passed
 through unchanged.
 
 Used only if MODE = COUNT.

Help.Tip: Header word designating primary bins.
Help.Text:
comp - HDR_PRI
Header word designating primary bins.
 
 Default = 7
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH
 
 Traces falling into the same lowest level bin are composited together.
 
 Used only if MODE = HDR.

Help.Tip: Value of HDR_PRI for center of the first primary bin.
Help.Text:
comp - PRI_INIT
Value of HDR_PRI for center of the first primary bin.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real
 
 Used only if MODE = HDR.

Help.Tip: Increment between primary bins.
Help.Text:
comp - PRI_INC
Increment between primary bins.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real>0.0
 
 Used only if MODE = HDR.

Help.Tip: Width of primary bins.
Help.Text:
comp - PRI_WID
Width of primary bins.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real>0.0
 
 Used only if MODE = HDR.

Help.Tip: Value of HDR_PRI for center of last primary bin.
Help.Text:
comp - PRI_LAST
Value of HDR_PRI for center of last primary bin.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real>=PRI_INIT
 
 Used only if MODE = HDR.

Help.Tip: Total number of primary bins.
Help.Text:
comp - PRI_TOT
Total number of primary bins.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = int>0
 
 Used only if MODE = HDR.

Help.Tip: Header word designating secondary bins.
Help.Text:
comp - HDR_SEC
Header word designating secondary bins.
 
 Default = 6
 Allowed = 0 - NWIH
 
 Traces falling into the same lowest level bin are composited together.
 
 If HDR_SEC = 0, then use only primary bins.
 
 Used only if MODE = HDR.

Help.Tip: Value of HDR_SEC for center of first secondary bin.
Help.Text:
comp - SEC_INIT
Value of HDR_SEC for center of first secondary bin.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real
 
 Used only if MODE = HDR and HDR_SEC > 0.

Help.Tip: Increment between secondary bins.
Help.Text:
comp - SEC_INC
Increment between secondary bins.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real>0.0
 
 Used only if MODE = HDR and HDR_SEC > 0.

Help.Tip: Width of secondary bins.
Help.Text:
comp - SEC_WID
Width of secondary bins.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real>0.0
 
 Used only if MODE = HDR and HDR_SEC > 0.

Help.Tip: Value of HDR_SEC for center of last secondary bin.
Help.Text:
comp - SEC_LAST
Value of HDR_SEC for center of last secondary bin.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real>=SEC_INIT
 
 Used only if MODE = HDR and HDR_SEC > 0.

Help.Tip: Total number of secondary bins.
Help.Text:
comp - SEC_TOT
Total number of secondary bins.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = int>0
 
 Used only if MODE = HDR and HDR_SEC > 0.

Help.Tip: Button that removes this process parameter screen.
Help.Text:
comp - CLOSE
Button that removes this process parameter screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Appears only on the view-only process parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
Help.Text:
comp - OK
Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values, runs the parameter traps and removes
 the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
Help.Text:
comp - APPLY
Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps but does
 not remove the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
Help.Text:
comp - CANCEL
Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =

Help.Tip: Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
Help.Text:
comp - RESET
Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that sets the parameters back to their values when the screen appeared
 or to their last applied value.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
Help.Text:
comp - PROCESSLISTLEFT
Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the previous process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
Help.Text:
comp - PROCESSLIST
Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Menu that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to any chosen process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
Help.Text:
comp - PROCESSLISTRIGHT
Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the next process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
Help.Text:
comp - PROJECTDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as Project Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of Project Defaults for a project.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
Help.Text:
comp - USERDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as User Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of User Defaults for a userid.

Help.Tip: Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
Help.Text:
comp - HELP
Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 The Help Window allows access to three kinds of help:  Parameter Help, CPS
 Process Help and Application (CFE) Help.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                         C P S   P R O C E S S
 
 Name       : COMP   (COMPosite traces)
 Category   : stacks
 Written    : 2000-05-01   by: Mike O'Brien
 Revised    : 2002-09-03   by: Tom Stoeckley
 Maturity   : production   2002-09-11
 Purpose    : General trace compositing process.
 Portability: No known limitations.
 Parallel   : No.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          GENERAL DESCRIPTION
 
 COMP is a general trace compositing process.  COMP is not designed to
 perform CMP composites or other composites that require stack scaling.
 
 Output Trace Scaling:
 
   Amplitudes of composited samples are the average of the live trace samples
   that are composited together.  If all traces composited together are dead,
   the amplitudes will be zero.
 
 Output Header Words:
 
   Output header word values, for composited traces, are the average of the
   corresponding header word values of all of the traces (live or dead)
   composited together.  Exceptions:  Header word 1 is reset to the correct
   sequential trace number.  Header word 5 is the sum of the header word 5
   values of the live traces composited together.  Header word 25 is set
   to the largest absolute value on the trace.  Note that header words
   which are usually integers (such as the mute headers) may have fractional
   parts after averaging.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                      DESCRIPTION FOR MODE = COUNT
 
 If MODE = COUNT, then COMP composites consecutive traces based on trace
 count (analogous to do-skip).
 
       SKIP_INIT       Number of traces to skip (pass through) initially,
       NUM_COMP        Number of traces to composite at a time,
       NUM_SKIP        Number of traces to skip (pass through) at a time,
       TOT_COMP        Total number of traces composited
 
 Input Trace Order for MODE = COUNT:
 
   For MODE = COUNT input traces may arrive in any desired order.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                       DESCRIPTION FOR MODE = HDR
 
 If MODE = HDR, then COMP composites traces that fall within the same lowest
 level bin, where the bins are defined by header words HDR_PRI and HDR_SEC.
 If HDR_SEC = 0, then only one level of bins is used.
 
 Input Trace Order for MODE = HDR:
 
   All input traces occupying the same primary bin must be received
   consecutively.  Within a primary bin, all input traces occupying the
   same secondary bin must be received consecutively.  Input traces that
   fall outside the bin array (or within gaps) will be deleted and will
   not trigger a change in the current bin number.  The primary and
   secondary bins need not be received in any particular order.
 
 Additional Output Header Words for MODE = HDR:
 
   Header word 3 is set to a counter which starts with 1 and increments
   each time the primary bin number changes.  Header word 4 is set to a
   counter which starts with 1 for the first trace in each binary bin, and
   increments for each trace within the binary bin.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                            ADVICE FOR USERS
 
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                             REVISION HISTORY
 
     Date        Author      Description
     ----        ------      -----------
  9. 2002-09-11  Stoeckley   Change to use the MTH module for binning.
  8. 2002-06-10  Stoeckley   Change operation of the COUNT mode back to the
                              original design of outputting uncomposited
                              traces instead of skipping them.
  7. 2002-05-22  Stoeckley   Completely re-written from scratch to fix
                              bugs, reduce the amount of code, and enhance
                              clarity and maintainability.
  6. 2001-08-02  Stoeckley   Fix problem with non-vanishing error box.
  5. 2001-04-26  Stoeckley   Change wrapup flag.
  4. 2000-07-26  O'Brien     Improved PRI_LAST,PRI_TOT,SEC_LAST,SEC_TOT traps.
                              Set SEC_*** fields insensitive when HDR_SEC=0.
                              Add warning when COMP sets ntr to NO_MORE_TRACES.
                              Fix bug with PRI_TOT counter.
                              Fix bug with NUM_SKIP=0 logic.
                              Fix bad normalization logic.
  3. 2000-06-08  O'Brien     Initialize NUMTR global.
  2. 2000-05-01  O'Brien     First version.
  1. 1999-11-16  C I Burch   Initial design.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
